column1: back of a length at off stump, opens the face and taps it between backward point and short third man
good length, late swing in at off stump, gets a stride across and gets the inside half of the bat as he pushes it to midwicket
loud appeal, but that's going down. Trademark inswinger from Sandeep, but it starts at middle and raps him on leg as he looks to whip over square leg
good length, swinging in at middle stump, defended to midwicket off the back foot

got him! What a sight! More inswing. This one is at a length too, nips back slightly. Mayank wants to crash this on the up through the off side, leaves a huge gap between bat and pad, perfect passageway to the stumps that are knocked out
full and swinging in at off stump, shuffles across and defends to cover point
good length, angled into the pads, flicked late, straight to short fine leg
good length at off stump, comes on slowly, he hangs back and taps it to backward point's left
good length, in the corridor, walks into the shot, punches it straight to covers
short and wide, eyes light up for Smith, but the ball skids through and beats the under edge on his attempted cut
short and wide again, hard hands from Smith once more, mistimes the punch and it bounces towards mid-off
good length, slight movement away from outside off. Follows it, opens the face and runs it down to third man
oh what a shot. Good length, about two stumps wide off of stump. He walks across the stumps and shovels this to deep square leg
good length, moves away marginally from the corridor, defended with an open face to third man
back of a length outside off, driven on the up to Amla at mid-off
back of a length at off stump, very close to the body, but he opens the face and chops it straight to short third man
full at off stump, leans in, turns the wrists and flicks it to deep square leg
good length outside off, slight movement away off the pitch, pushed into the covers off the front foot
dot ball pressure. Steps out and swings haphazardly across the line, misses the line and the length completely. This flies over the off stump

dropped. Vohra puts it down at cover. This is good length, tries to whip it on the up, across the line. Leading edge hangs up in the cover region. Vohra has to run backwards as debutant Natarajan backs away at extra cover. That was Natarajan's catch. In the end, Vohra has too much to think about and lets it slip as he goes to the ground
good length at off stump, walks across and whips it off the middle to deep square
shot. Bouncer at middle stump at that pace will never trouble Rahane. Rocks back and nails the hook shot, which flies over short fine
good length at off stump, this time  no feet. Stays in the crease, watches it closely, opens the face at the last moment and runs it past where first slip would have been
and again. This is slightly shorter than the previous ball, he's taller at the crease as he runs it to third man
good length at middle stump, tails away from Rahane as he leans in but he can offer enough of the face to push it to mid-on on the up
good length at off stump, Smith doesn't lean in like Rahane, but can whip it to mid-on anyway
good length at off stump, turns it into open leg side
a familiar sight in recent times. Good length, moving away from off stump, not a bad ball. But Smith's superhuman wrists are at this, on the up, and get it through cover point
even better. Good length at middle stump, gives the charge, makes some room and uses his wrists to cream it between cover and extra
and now he whips a similar ball from a length to deep square leg's right. This one was shaping away too
full at off stump, driven inside-out to find extra cover
good length at middle stump, hangs in the crease and glances it to deep square
good length, angled in at the pads, flicked to short fine's left
sneaks through between his legs. Short and angled down leg, Smith wants to pull, but this skids on and keeps low to bisect his legs
and repeat, this time he gets a tickle on it through to Saha who doesn't collect
good length, fired in at middle stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
short and angled across him, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover

he has Rahane off his second ball. Full and wide outside off stump, Rahane wants to crash this over the cover boundary but he's not to the pitch of the ball. Bat turns in his hands as he executes the sliced shot and it is straight to Stoinis at sweeper cover
short and wide, chopped straight to point
shoooooot. Full, slight shape back but Smith seems to know it's coming. Full face as he drives - beats the bowler, beats mid-on, beats long-off
back of a length at off stump, swivels across and pulls this square between the two deep fielders in the leg side
in the blockhole, wide outside off stump, Smith doesn't shuffle this ball and so can't reach it. Beaten.
good length at middle stump, pushed to long-on off the front foot
good length at off stump, soft-handed push to deep midwicket
full at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
good length at middle stump, jumps down the track and pushes it on the up to long-on
good length, angled across middle stump, closes the face and tucks it to deep square
good length at off stump, not to the pitch, but drives on the up and gets it wide of long-off
good length, down the leg side, evades Smith's hoick but gives away a run anyway

gone! Holed out to deep square. This is back of a length, angles down the leg side but sits in the pitch and straightens. It was awkward and climbed on Smith who was through his leg glance. Gets it high on the bat and Vohra runs to his right again, backwards again - and holds on this time
good length outside off, punches on the up, misfield at extra cover allows a single
good length, angled down the leg side, past his thigh guard...might have flicked it, there was a sound. But the umpire didn't make anything of it
good length at middle stump, defended back to the bowler
almost chops it on. Good length outside off, pokes at it from the crease, the inside edge evades the stumps and rolls down to fine leg
good length at off stump, pushed on the up to long-on
good length, angled in at leg stump, pushed back down the pitch as that comes on slowly
full at leg stump, hammered straight to long-on, all along the ground
good length at off stump, steps out early, not to the pitch, defended back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, cuts it past the diving point fielder, finds sweeper
good length at leg stump, pushed to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length, angled in at leg stump, pushed to deep square leg
you don't bowl there to Stokes. Tossed up generously at middle stump, he clears the front leg and launches this over the midwicket boundary
back of a length at off stump, comes on slowly after pitching, forced to tap back to the bowler
good length at off stump, taps it into the leg side, very late, soft hands
short and angled across him. He wants to bludgeon this through midwicket, but there isn't enough pace in this pitch for back foot shots. Thick inside edge to fine leg
bouncer, way down the leg side, lets it go
back of a length at middle stump, tucked off the back foot to deep square
rolls his fingers on this, good length, wide outside off. Beats him for pace, beats him for line, gets his edge - still ends up giving four through third man
good length outside off, sits up like a short ball, slapped on the up, straight to mid-off
back of a length at off stump, punched off the back foot to extra cover

takes it on the fourth attempt. Tossed up at off stump, looks to force this through the off side. He's reaching out for it. Not to the pitch, lobs it back to Swapnil who probably is a bit flustered that he has foxed Dhoni. Makes a meal of an easy take, but hangs on in the end
good length, angled in at leg stump, pushed into the leg side off the front foot
good length at middle stump, taoped to deep midwicket off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, goes on the back foot, and just manages to push it past the bowler for a single. Slight mix-up there but safe in the end
full and flat at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
full and angled in at leg stump, feet rooted to the crease but gets the flick off the middle of the bat, gets it wide of long-on
yet another inside edge on this slow pitch. Back of a length, angled across off stump, wants to run it to third man, chops it into the leg side
slower ball, full at the pads, flicked to deep square leg

good looking shot. This is full and wide outside off stump, similar to Rahane's dismissal, but Tiwary has leaned in and kept low. He also has more pace - uses it to lift it inside-out and get it wide of sweeper
back of a length outside off, mistimed under edge into the off side as he plays on the back foot
low full toss at middle stump, punched straight to long-on
good length, flat and angled across off stump, punched off the back foot to long-off
good length outside off, goes deep in the crease and flicks across the line to the open leg side. Dangerous shot on this pitch
short at middle stump, hurries him slightly but he has seen enough of this to pull it between the two deep fielders
shot. Full outside off, gets on one knee and lifts this over the bowler
good length at leg stump, taps it to deep midwicket off the back foot
full at off stump, gets to the pitch, turns his wrists and finds deep square
good length outside off, Tiwary continues to offer the angled bat on this pitch. Premeditates the paddle sweep, but it's too wide and he's beaten
good length outside off stump, pushed on the up, bottom of the bat, to extra cover
yorker at leg stump, clipped off his toes to deep square leg

oh what a shot! Why swat across the line when you can do that? Natarajan bowls this full and wide - he does one or two of these every over - Tiwary hangs low, gets to the pitch and slices this over the point boundary
back of a length outside off, rolled his fingers on it, dabbed down to third man
in the blockhole at off stump, squeezed out to extra cover

back of a length at his pads, he whips it to deep midwicket's left and comes back for a sharp second. A direct hit might have caused trouble, but his slide and the half-volley throw are enough this time

get out of the way! This has gone about chest height over the long-on boundary. Just wide of the fielder there, but there is no way he was going to chance his fingers at that. Whew. Steps out, picks the slower ball and slaps it on the up
slower ball, full outside off stump, goes for the switch hit. More flourish than result. Straight to sweeper cover
back of a length at middle stump, clears the front leg and pulls it to deep midwicket
hangs deep in the crease again, swivels and slogs this length ball to long leg
back of a length, into the pads, gets slightly inside the line and bisects fine leg and deep square
good length, just outside off, right in the slot for his big swing, but this cuts away slightly and beats the outside edge
yorker outside off stump, forces him to drag this down to long-on off the bottom of the bat
overpitched outside off, opens the face and tries to tickle this past short third man, but finds him
slower ball, full outside off stump, he gets this one off the bottom too as he hoicks across the line. Straight to deep midwicket
oh the perfect cover drive, but only one. Overpitched outside off stump, nicely behind this and gets it bang off the middle. But extra cover dives low to his right and gets a hand
a fifty for Stokes. Low full toss outside off stump, angling across, once more he reaches, once more he gets it off the bottom to long-on
good length, fired down the leg side, past the attempted slog sweep, good take down the leg side
good length, fired flat outside off stump this time, past the pat again
short ball at leg stump, wants to send his some way over the roof, but it raps him on the thigh guard
good length at middle stump, pushed into the leg side off the back foot

gone! Stokes' love-affair with the toe of the bat has led to his downfall. This is good length, wide outside off stump. Wants to butcher this on the up through the off side, but he catches it low and lobs back at the bowler who will have taken way harder ones than these in his time
arm ball, good length at off stump, wants to tuck it into the leg side, gets an inside edge onto leg
arm ball at middle stump, glanced to deep square
steps out, not to the pitch as. Throws his arms at this as it skids in towards him, no substantial connection, rolls feebly into the leg side and the bowler gets across
low full toss at leg stump, punched strongly, straight to long-on
top-class batting. Mohit misses the yorker marginally and he's nice and deep in the crease, waiting under this and unleashes a beautiful swing to lift it over long-on
bouncer at middle stump, jammed into the floor on the leg side with a hook

slower ball, full at middle stump, gets low and sweeps this with good connection. It's dipping at Vohra at deep square leg but he keeps his eyes on the ball and holds on to it on the bounce while diving forward
no one is holding on to this though. Back of the hand slower ball, back of a length at middle stump, steps out and pulls it past Axar who can't get to it with a slide to his right at deep midwicket
another back of the hand slower ball, tossed up full at off stump, this time he's through the sweep early and he gets it off the toe of the bat to long-on
yorker at leg stump from around the wicket, jammed out to deep midwicket
nicely improvised. He wants to paddle, but this one is full and wide outside leg and he has to reach for it. Manages to do it, tickles it fine
more in the slot this time. Waiting for the low full toss at leg stump, gets it, lifts it over the keeper
...and goes short. And wide. Outside off. Sits up for Christian who walks across ever so slightly and pulls this well in front of square and over the boundary

oh good catch. This is overpitched at off stump, Christian will back himself to hit this out of the park any day. On this occassion, he gets the bottom of the bat. It loops in front of Maxwell at long-on, but he watches it closely and moves down with it to catch it inches off the floor
yorker outside off stump, can only squeeze this down the ground to Maxwell at long-on, who is onto it quickly and throws it on the bounce to the keeper's end to keep it down to one
starts off with a good-length ball angling in towards off stump. Amla jabs down on it, from the crease, to defend into the off side
length ball, a little wider, opens his bat face to dab to backward point
off the mark with a fluky boundary. Width this time, fairly short too. Amla throws his bat at it and gets a thick edge that races away wide of wide slip
fullish outside off, driven airily, on the up, to the left of cover. There's a man at deep point who sweeps up to his right
short, rising ball close to off stump. Vohra hops to ride the bounce and dab it down to third man
back of a length, close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs to short third man - point went back to the boundary and third man came into the circle after the strike turned over
Starts off with a length ball that nips away in the corridor with extra bounce. Beats Vohra's tentative defensive poke
long way down the leg side this time, Vohra can't even attempt to connect with that
shot. A bit of width, short, and Vohra just punches it over the up, over backward point, and easily beats the sweeper to his left
fullish, on middle stump, clipped in the air towards deep square leg
back of a length close to off stump, punched away to deep point
looks for the yorker, maybe. Length is perfect, line is all wrong, a long way down the leg side
length ball outside off, nips in slightly. Looks to drive on the up through cover and inside-edges it through square leg
length ball on off stump, Amla shuffles across, knows fine leg is inside the circle, and just clips it away, to the left of that fielder
down the track, and Vohra has smashed that. Dinda sees him coming and shortens his length, but Vohra doesn't care, just flat-bats it back over the bowler's head, and it carries all the way
back of a length close to off stump, dabbed to third man
short and wide, not too bad a ball with deep point  back. Cut away for one
short ball outside off. Vohra thought of cutting, but it bounced a fair deal and he decided to leave instead

a step out of his crease again, and Dinda bangs it in even shorter this time. This one gets up to shoulder height, and this time it was angled into Vohra, cramping him for room, and he top-edges his flat-bat leg-side swat and deep square leg moves to his left to take the catch
back of a length on off stump, punched firmly back but Dinda gets down quickly to field it in his follow-through, stops it with his left hand
back of a length, angling down leg again. Saha looks to glance, can only get some thigh pad on it. Dhoni dives left and stops the ball

shortish, just a bit of width, and that's put away brilliantly - both backward point and cover point were in the circle, and he jumped, got on top of the bounce, and split the gap with some deft use of his hands and wrists
fuller now, outside off. Saha drags it to mid-on with a lot of bottom hand

good ball, nips back from just short of a good length. Saha is caught on the shuffle, looking to work it across the line. Big lbw appeal, not given. There was no inside-edge, but it was given as leg-byes. Would have missed the stumps anyway - height was an issue too
shortish and a lot of width, and Amla has just creamed it. Clears his front leg to make extra room, and slaps it away over cover
full on off stump, clears his front leg again and whips it hard, but straight to mid-on
dropped! Skips down the track and gets a wide length ball. Looks to drive over short cover, who dives to his right, gets a hand to it, but can't hold on - Christian is the fielder

whoops. Length ball close to off stump. Looks to hit over extra-cover and he's too early into his shot. May have been the slower offcutter. Drags it in the air, towards mid-on, but it bounces well short
full outside off, nearly a yorker. Amla opens his bat face to squeeze it out to deep point
slower ball, on off stump. Just back of a length, and Saha puts it away brilliantly. Spots it early, holds his shape, and punches it crisply between cover point and extra-cover
bang, another. Fullish on off stump and Saha clears his front leg to launch it over mid-off
Full, this time he hits the blockhole on off stump. Saha jabs it back to the bowler
length ball on middle and leg, clipped to long-on

bowled him! The googly again, and again, the length. Saha is rooted to the crease, doesn't know which way it's turning, and the ball skids through between bat and body and crashes into middle and off. Not sure what shot Saha was trying to play - maybe a punch through cover, and then had to hurriedly change that to a flick, by which time it was too late
back of a length, turns in towards middle stump, goes back to work it towards square leg
back of a length on off stump, whipped away to deep midwicket

very full, on middle stump. LBW appeal after Axar walks across to flick. Rolls towards Bhatia, who misfields at short fine leg, and it runs away for four. All bat. Tahir thought it may have hit Axar's foot first
length ball pitching middle and leg and turning down leg, worked away to deep backward square leg
full, close to off stump, driven towards mid-off
length ball on off stump, takes a big back-and-across step before punching down the ground to long-off
back of a length, angling across Axar. No room to dab it to third man, ends up inside-edging into the ground, not too far from off stump
short, angling across. Not too much width again, can't play the full-blooded cut. Chops it instead, on the bounce to backward point
full on off stump, jabbed towards extra-cover
this time he can complete his delivery stride and bowl. Sends down a full ball outside off, driven to extra-cover
back of a length outside off, dabbed to short third man
very full on off stump, jabbed back to the bowler
length ball slanted across Axar. Stays on the back foot to punch to long-off
back of a length on middle stump, goes back and across to work it to deep backward square leg
floated up full and wide, Axar drives with a lot of bottom hand, down to long-off. A more top-handed drive may have enabled him to go over extra-cover
length ball on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
back of a length on middle and leg, goes back to punch to long-on
ooh, quickish legbreak pitching on middle and off, length ball. Looks to drive through cover and gets a thick edge to backward point
a touch shorter, goes back to cut but not too much width. Can't beat backward point
shortish on off stump, pull-whipped to long-on
quickish, back of a length on middle and leg, worked away through backward square leg

long-hop sliding down leg, he's lucky Amla's placement isn't great. Looks to hit it between short fine leg and deep square leg, ends up hitting it too close to the latter to get more than one for the shot

length ball outside off, some sort of cutter for sure, Amla looks to clear his front leg and make himself hitting room to slap over cover. Is too early through his shot and drags it in the air, on the bounce, to long-on
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-off
slower legcutter wide of off stump, slogged away to deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump, swatted away to deep square leg
floaty slower ball outside off, looks to flat-bat that to the right of mid-off, doesn't get the power he wants and the fielder can move quickly and keep it down to a single

slower offcutter this time, wide of off stump. Axar slogs it along the ground, hits it hard, between deep midwicket and long-on. Stokes moves to his right from deep midwicket and stops it with a tumble
short, pitches on off and turns away, Amla punches it away to deep point
short again, well outside off this time, gives Axar a lot of room to free his arms and slog that away down the ground, easily clears long-on
quickish legbreak, ends up sliding down the leg side. Good take from Dhoni after Axar misses the glance
another legbreak down the leg side. This time Dhoni can only stop it with his pads
back of a length on middle and off, clipped down to long-on
quick legbreak on off stump, Amla looks to get under it and hit with the turn, over extra-cover. Ends up hitting it straighter than he'd like, and picks out Stokes at long-off
back of a length, turning down leg. Clips Axar's pad as he looks to glance
another massive wide. Well wide of off stump this time, Axar simply leaves it
fullish on middle and off, clipped to deep midwicket

another for Tahir. He reacts, as always, like he's just won the World Cup. Floated up outside off, Axar goes for the big hoick over the leg side. Doesn't turn as much as he expected, and he ends up hitting it straight up in the air, off the outside half of the bat, and it's Tahir himself who settles under this ballooner, moving towards midwicket to catch it
back of a length googly, shuffles across and works it to deep backward square leg
tossed up outside off, gets a good stride out to drive to long-off
tossed up outside off, lands on a good length. Don't think Maxwell knew which way it was turning. It was the legbreak, and he reads it off the pitch and opens his bat face to dab behind point
back of a length outside off, chopped down to short third man
quickish length ball angling across Miller, whips it back to the bowler
bam. Floated up outside off, lands right in Maxwell's slot, just takes a big step out and lets his bat flow through a clean lofted hit, straight back over the bowler
length ball on middle and off, opens his bat face to dab towards point
full on leg stump, clipped to long-on

length ball pitching middle and leg and turning towards middle, clipped gently towards deep midwicket. Just enough weight on the shot to allow them to run two. They end up running four after a direct hit at the bowler's end runs away for overthrows. They're checking with the third umpire anyway. Miller was well in at that point. Not sure who the thrower was.
quickish delivery down the leg side. I don't know how many wides he's bowled today. Too wide for Maxwell to get bat on the glance
too quick and flat, on middle and leg, for Maxwell to time his slog or get elevation. Cleared his front leg. Ended up dragging it along the ground to long-on
quickish legbreak on off stump. Miller shows the full face to push to long-off
back of a length close to off stump, chopped away towards deep point

back of a length on middle stump, and Maxwell does brilliantly to hit that for four. He knows it's going to be stump-to-stump, so exposes all his stumps, makes a lot of room, and slaps it away to the cover boundary
what Maxwell did the previous ball makes Bhatia change his line, and Maxwell moves across to pick up a wide down the leg side. Dhoni fumbles to allow another run
back of a length on off stump, punched to short extra
slower offcutter angled away from off stump. Miller misreads it, is too early into his slog, misses. Keeps a touch low too, and Dhoni does well to collect that behind the stumps
overpitched this time, on off stump, and Miller punishes it. Clears his front leg and brings in a lot of bat-speed to lift that over the bowler's head
back of a length outside off. Too early into his attempted punch through point, ends up dragging it back to the bowler, on the bounce
short, angling in sharply. Looks to make room and stab it over short third man. Can't get bat on it.
short, wide, cracked away powerfully and even though deep point has only 10 yards or so to cover to his right, he had no chance

full on off stump. Looks to shuffle across and whip it into the leg side. Inside-edges into his pad, and then it dribbles into the square leg region. He was plumb if there was no edge on it. Huge appeal, rightly given not out
full on off stump, shows the full face to punch to long-on
length ball slanting into the pads, whipped powerfully but straight to midwicket

fullish on middle stump, and Maxwell, being Maxwell plays it with the field in mind. Makes himself room and launches it over mid-off, who's in the circle, lots of bottom hand, and it sails all the way over the rope
full on middle and off, clipped to long-off

short, and Maxwell rocks back in an instant to pull this up and over. Into the gap between long-on and deep midwicket as well. The placement helped, because he didn't middle it, ended up slicing underneath it somewhat
another short ball, and this time he's smashed it. Monstrous pull waaay over wide long-on
floaty legbreak wide of off stump. Maxwell is beaten in the air, beaten by the lack of pace. Looks to launch that over mid-off, ends up swinging through thin air
full-toss, hip-high, angling down leg, swatted away to deep square leg
tossed up wide of off, driven to long-off
googly, pitches outside off, and turns a long way away. Miller shapes to cut, has to check himself because it turns so much
another googly. Looks to sweep, misses, and it ricochets off pad into the off side
shortish, close to off stump, keeps a little low as he makes room to cut. Has to chop it down into the ground, a short way into the cover point region
legbreak tossed up outside off, turns a long way and Maxwell's slog hits the toe end and rolls to midwicket
looks for the reverse-sweep, misses, and Dhoni bellows a huge appeal for lbw. Looks to have pitched in line and gone straight on. May have been sliding down leg
fullish on the stumps, clipped back to the bowler
yorker on leg stump. Maxwell had moved away from leg stump well before release. Drags it off the toe end of the bat down to long-on
full, close to off stump, extra cover gets his left hand on the ball to slow down a firm drive from Miller
bouncer, Miller steps across to try and hook, can't connect and it sails over his right shoulder

in the blockhole on middle stump, and what a shot that is! That delivery is blameless, and Miller simply makes himself room and shovels under it, with a dead-straight bat, back over the bowler's head, and into the rope on the full. Christian, diving to his right from long-on, can't quite get a hand to it
leg-stump yorker, clipped away through square leg
full on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length close to off stump, a bit of off-cut on that. Miller gets behind it to defend to short cover
short, gets up to chest height, and Miller is back and across in a flash to pull it, bat coming from up to down, and swivels to place it to the left of deep square leg. Super shot
wide yorker, Miller gets down low, looks for the flat-bat slap, and misses
sees him coming down the track and cramps him with a slower ball into the body. Defends with a straight bat into the covers
wide yorker, slashed away, thick edge down to third man
predictably, given the field, a bouncer, and he loses his line and whangs it a long way down the leg side while taking a tumble in his follow-through
full on off stump, and that is that. A straight-bat push to the left of midwicket, off a full ball on off stump, and a quick single
